patterns: Eikon API to retrieve timeseries data through R package

use Eikon Data API with R
responses: As far as I know, there is R library available by an external source - it is not supported by Refinitv, but should give idea of how it can be used. You can find that library here: https://github.com/ahmedmohamedali/eikonapir

You can find the list of Eikon APIs from https://developers.refinitiv.com/en/api-catalog/eikon/eikon-data-api. Anyway Eikon Data API can be used with python.

patterns: Which API can use to retrieve data from RTDS
Which API can use to retrieve data from ADS
Which API can use to retrieve data from Refinitiv Real Time
Which API can publish data to RTDS
Which API can use to publish data to ADH
responses: You can use Refinitiv Real-Time SDK (RTSDK) such as EMA API to retrieve, publish and contribute data. See more details from https://developers.refinitiv.com/en/use-cases-catalog/refinitiv-real-time, there is download section in each API.

EMA(C++/Java) can consuming and publishing data to Refinitiv Real-Time. You can use RTSDK to contribute data to RCC. Find more details from https://developers.refinitiv.com/en/use-cases-catalog/refinitiv-real-time

patterns: How to download Open DACS API
Give me a list of RTSDK APIs
responses: You can download RTSDK from  https://developers.refinitiv.com/en/use-cases-catalog/refinitiv-real-time. Or go to github https://github.com/Refinitiv/Real-Time-SDK
If you use GitHub you can download RTSDK from github https://github.com/Refinitiv/Real-Time-SDK. Find more tutorial from  https://github.com/Refinitiv/Real-Time-SDK

patterns: On what scenarios one should Prefer ETA over EMA?
Should I use EMA or EMA?
responses: ETA is targeted for applications that need very high throughput with the lowest latency we offer. In addition, it exposes a wide array of tuning options so you have the ability to control your network layer down to the last detail. EMA is still quite performant but defaults many configuration options and provides more ease of use for rapid onboarding and a more intuitive user experience. If you are finding that EMA is able to handle your use case it sounds like you are at the right layer!

patterns: difference between API products: RFA vs ETA vs EMA vs UPA
Can you compare EMA and ETA
Can you compare RFA and EMA?
responses:
As for differences, in summary:
RFA is our legacy feature complete API
UPA has now been re-branded as Enterprise Transport API (ETA)
ETA is our lowest level highest performance strategic API
Enterprise Message API is a higher level strategic API which is easier to use whilst still offering a high level of performance.
For most developers EMA is the recommend API for any new development or rewrite of existing applications. The performance should be more than adequate for the majority of use case scenarios.It is much easier to learn, less code is required to implement functionality and therefore also easier to maintain long term.
For those requiring the highest level of performance e.g. algorithmic trading - they should consider ETA.
For a high level overview of EMA please refer them to article Introduction to Enterprise Message API(https://developers.refinitiv.com/en/article-catalog/article/introduction-elektron-message-api) as well as the Refinitiv Real-Time SDK page https://developers.refinitiv.com/en/use-cases-catalog/refinitiv-real-time.
You can find details regarding Refinitiv Real-Time SDK from https://developers.refinitiv.com/en/use-cases-catalog/refinitiv-real-time
Find more details from https://developers.refinitiv.com/en/use-cases-catalog/refinitiv-real-time

patterns: Can I use RTSDK on Linux?
Can I use RFA on RHEL7
Can I use EMA on RHEL7
Can I use EMA on Linux?
Can I use Real-Time SDK on Linux
Can I use RTSDK on Windows
Can I use EMA with gcc 4.x
responses: You can use Refinitiv Real-Time APIs (RFA, OpenDACS, etc) and Real-Time SDK(EMA/ETA) on Windows and Linux. Anyway please find supported OS and Compiler from API Compatibility Matrix https://developers.refinitiv.com/en/api-catalog/refinitiv-real-time-opnsrc/rt-sdk-cc/documentation#api-compatibility-matrix

patterns: Where can I download RTSDK for .NET?
responses: Currently Refinitiv Real-Time SDK (RTSDK) does not support .NET. Only C++ and Java version available on https://github.com/Refinitiv/Real-Time-SDK or https://developers.refinitiv.com/en/use-cases-catalog/refinitiv-real-time

RTSDK does not support .NET. The Websocket API seems to be the only one which can support .NET as it is language agnostic. There are code samples in most programming language, including .NET and Python.
